metadata.title: CVE-2019-11006 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20190322 Q8, there is a heap-based bufferover-read in the function ReadMIFFImage of coders/miff.c, which allowsattackers to cause a denial of service or information disclosure via an RLEpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.4~hg15968-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.4~hg15968-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4~hg15968-1').
